results.title: VUWAE 15, Darwin Mountains, Antarctica
results.creator_credit: John Pettigrew, Peter Barrett and Victoria University of Wellington Antarctic Expedition
results.brief_description: Shows the geological research carried out by members of the fifteenth Victoria University of Wellington Antarctic Expedition (VUWAE 15). A party of four measure and describe the exposed outcrops of the Darwin Mountains, part of the Transantarctic Mountains. Presents a detailed description of the geology of the area.

results.title: Vukani awake
results.creator_credit: Lionel Ngakane and Concord Films Council for the African National Congress
results.brief_description: Shows the plight of black Africans in South Africa. The first film of protest against the South African situation made by a South African, Lionel Ngakane. Some of the original footage was smuggled out of South Africa, while the compilation material was assembled from a wide variety of African and British sources.

results.title: VTR St-Jacques
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Sherr Klein, George C. Stoney and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An experiment in using videotape recording (VTR) and closed-circuit television to stimulate social action in a poor district of Montreal. A citizens’ committee, formed in the downtown neighborhood of St-Jacques, was given a VTR unit, which they used to record people’s problems and concerns. After viewing the edited tapes, people recognized their common problems and began to talk of joint solutions. In trying to change what needed changing they ran into resistance, but the effectiveness of this means of promoting joint action had been tested and proved. In English and French with English subtitles.

results.title: Vronsky and Babin. Part two
results.creator_credit: S.K. Winston, Walter Lowendahl and Artists Films
results.brief_description: Part two of a two-part series. The internationally famous duo-pianists, Vitya Vronsky and Victor Babin, play the Polovitizian Dances, from Borodin’s opera “Prince Igor”. In this film the pianos are placed side by side so that both keyboards may be observed at the same time.

results.title: Voyager = Homo Faber
results.creator_credit: Volker Schlondorff, Eberhard Junkersdorf, Action Films and Bioskop Film
results.brief_description: Set in the 1950’s, “Voyager” follows the meandering travels of construction engineer Walter Faber (Sam Shepard) through six countries. Told in flashback, the protagonist relates circumstances behind the series of chance events that lead him to meet and fall in love with a strangely familiar young woman (Julie Delphi) on board a ship to France a, meeting that is to have tragic consequences. Based on the novel ‘Homo Faber’ by Max Frisch.

results.title: Voyage to the bottom on the sea
results.creator_credit: Irwin Allen, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Windsor Productions
results.brief_description: Atmospheric adventure film and science fiction classic, “Voyage to the bottom of the sea” tells of a routine scientific exploration mission to the North Pole which goes horribly awry. The submarine crew, helmed by Admiral Harriman Nelson, a taciturn old-school navy man, are alarmed to discover that the Van Allen radiation belt has been ignited by a freak meteor shower, and the earth and sky are afire. Nelson, at loggerheads with his deputy, makes the inflammatory decision to extinguish the inferno by detonating a nuclear missile. Despite the censure of the United Nations, Nelson presses ahead with his scheme, whilst combating natural disasters, mutiny, giant sea creatures and a religious zealot on board. This film won many accolades for its special effects (state-of-the-art for its day), with a screenplay reflective of public concerns about potential apocalyptic nuclear disasters.

results.title: Voyage to Melonia: a fantasy based on Shakespeare's play "The Tempest"
results.brief_description: Loosely based on Shakespeare’s play “The Tempest” this delightful animated film from Sweden tells the story of young Ferdinand’s escape from slavery on the island of Plutonia to the magical island of Melonia. On Melonia he meets Miranda, her father Prospero, Hobb, a friendly spirit and the ever-complaining gardener, Caliban. With their help he returns to Plutonia to rescue his fellow slaves and defeat the island’s evil rulers Muck and Myer.

results.title: Voyage to Italy = Viaggio in Italia
results.creator_credit: Roberto Rossellini, Marcello D'Amico, Speva Films and Italia Film
results.brief_description: Voyage to Italy marked Rosellini’s break with the aesthetics of neo-realism. Ingrid Bergman and George Sanders play a bored English couple who realise their marriage is falling apart while on a working holiday in Italy. The film is structured as a series of seemingly random scenes in which the disintegration of the marriage is viewed through the relationship between the characters and their external world. This deliberately “clinical” mise-en-scene outraged critics on the film’s initial release. However for a new generation of film-makers Rosellini’s work in “Voyage to Italy” marked the beginning of an intellectual cinema dedicated to examining the existential condition of modern Europe.

results.title: Voyage of the damned
results.creator_credit: Stuart Rosenberg, Robert Fryer and Associated General Films
results.brief_description: A gripping, moving film with an all star cast and based on the book by Gordon Thomas and Max Morgan-Witts. It is the tragic tale of 937 German Jewish refugees who left Nazi Germany in 1939 on a ship bound for Cuba. The voyage was part of a propaganda exercise by Goebbels who had arranged that the ship would not be allowed to dock in Havana. As the ship headed towards the United States, President Roosevelt denied entry to the ship. A return to Hamburg would mean certain death in the concentration camps, a fate which the passengers resolved to prevent.
